pullRequest.body:
---

Some minor questions:
* I proved `Continuous (SchwartzMap.toLp : ùì¢(E, F) ‚Üí ‚Ü•(Lp F p Œº))` by bounding the norm of the L^p function using a finite family of Schwartz seminorms. I didn't show that the Schwartz functions are dense in L^p. I wonder whether it's possible/preferable to obtain Continuous using that method?
* Would it be better to remove `toLp` and rename `toLpCLM` to `toLp` to minimize the number of definitions and reduce clutter?

Note: I have also prepared #20372. Combining `ContinuousLinearMap.bilinearCompLpL` with `L1.integralCLM'` and `SchwartzMap.toLpCLM` will make it possible to define tempered distributions from functions in `L^p`.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: jvlmdr can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review and the suggestions, much appreciated!

bors r+

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13063118069/job/36450404031)

Rebased and made fixes

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13063782009/job/36452383000)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13063782009/job/36452382797)

bors d+
Thanks!
This looks great, thanks a lot. I think your design with `toLp` first, then upgraded to a continuous linear map, is very good like that.

bors d+
Thanks!
This lemma is not really about the Schwartz space, rather about measures with temperate growth. Do you think you could move it to a place more in line with its statement?

I've moved it closer to the definition of `Measure.HasTemperateGrowth` (and its property `exists_integrable`) in the same file. I thought perhaps it made more sense within `section Lp`, but either is fine by me!
Could you use `‚Ñù‚â•0` instead of `NNReal`? (You might need to `open scoped NNReal` if it's not already done in the file)
Done
What about writing this as a `calc` block? You are nesting a `le_trans` with a `le_of_eq_of_le`, this is the kind of things for which `calc` is really making things more readable.
Thanks, that's much nicer. Done
Do you know `gcongr`? Here it wouldn't make a big difference, but it's often very handy.
I wasn't familiar with this tactic, thanks!

Instead of writing out a new (bundled) definition, it is often more convenient to state this as the fact that `toLp` is an injective function. In practice, the type of embeddings is not used a lot throughout mathlib for this reason.
Done

```suggestion
    cases eq_or_ne (p : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû) 0 with
```

```suggestion
      let k := ‚åà(l / p : ‚Ñù)‚åâ‚Çä
      have hlk : l ‚â§ k * (p : ‚Ñù) := by simpa [div_le_iff‚ÇÄ hp_pos] using Nat.le_ceil (l / p : ‚Ñù)
```
`generalize` is a little bit strange here, better use `let` or `set`.

```suggestion
    gcongr
```
`gcongr` is clever enough to match things by itself most of the time. The advanced syntax is only useful in more specific situations where it gets it wrong.

```suggestion
```
The docstring gives the impression this is a theorem and not a definition. Can you adapt it?

```suggestion
  mkCLMtoNormedSpace (fun f ‚Ü¶ f.toLp p Œº) (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ rfl) (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ rfl) <| by
    rcases norm_toLp_le_seminorm ùïú F p Œº with ‚ü®k, C, hC_pos, hC‚ü©
    exact ‚ü®Finset.Iic (k, 0), C, hC_pos, hC‚ü©
```

```suggestion
@[simp] theorem toLpCLM_apply {p : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû} [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)] {Œº : Measure E} [hŒº : Œº.HasTemperateGrowth]
```

```suggestion
@[fun_prop]
theorem continuous_toLp {p : ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû} [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)] {Œº : Measure E} [hŒº : Œº.HasTemperateGrowth] :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/Distribution): Add memLp, toLp, toLpCLM, continuous_toLp for SchwartzMap
